title: 保贊成為史上第七位在四大聯賽都取得入球球員

replies.msg:
Bojan Krkic has become the first Spanish player to score in the top four leagues in Europe

Bojan joins a select group of players who have tasted goal scoring success in England, Spain, Germany and Italy.

Kevin-Prince Boateng, brother of Bayern Munich defender Jerome Boateng, recently achieved the feat while with La Liga club Las Palmas, after also scoring league goals for Tottenham, Portsmouth, AC Milan and Schalke.

Former Newcastle United striker Obafemi Martins added his name to the illustrious list back in 2012 while with Spanish club Levante, having also scored for Inter Milan and Wolfsburg earlier in his career.

Another former Newcastle player, Denmark legend Jon Dahl Tomasson, also achieved the feat in 2007 when he scored for Villarreal, following spells with the Magpies, AC Milan and Stuttgart.

That same year, former Bologna, Fulham and Espanyol defender Pierre Wome became the first African footballer to score in all four leagues when he netted for Werder Bremen.

Meanwhile, Romanian duo Florin Raducioiu (AC Milan, Espanyol, West Ham and Stuttgart) and Gica Popescu (Tottenham, Barcelona, Lecce and Hannover) were the first two players to achieve the feat around the turn of the millennium.
